parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.12
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns mass of a PhysX object.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''getMass''' object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_mass = [[getMass]] _myCar</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getCenterOfMass]], [[setCenterOfMass]], [[setMass]], [[load]], [[weightRTD]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 15, 2015 - 20:15 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This function will return 0 for infantry AI units. That means a manned Blufor Hunter has the same mass than an empty one (8306.63).
Crates return their initial mass, but if you empty them or load items, magazines and weapons, the mass remains the same. In fact, none of these (non-physx) objects has a mass.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
